pros: Sorted and distributed food to people
cons: No cons good company good

pros: Friendly staff, great cause, flexibility, good benefits, community atmosphere.
cons: Everyday redundancy, traveling for work.

job_title: Class A Cdl Driver in Sacramento, CA
pros: Staff is really helpful and all are professionals
cons: Feel like blessed to work for second harvest

pros: Good work good people, liked it. Made a lot of lifetime friends and truly enjoyed the work I was doing.
cons: Long hours and not lots of room for promotion. Other than that I do not have any complaints. All good.

review_title: Purpose driven, but trouble pivoting with the times
pros: Great that you get to help feed people just by doing your job even if it is unrelated to physically handing out food.
cons: the organization was slow to adapt to the Silicon Valley way of work.  Old office, old technology, old ways of doing business, and past prime co-workers.

pros: They deeply care about the food distribution and nutrition education they provide to the community.
cons: I didn't really think there was one.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Jose, CA
pros: Everyone here has a passion to end hunger and help the community. It was wonderful working with such an amazing and passionate group of people. Good work-life balance -- company encourages healthy lifestyle. I wish we had more staff-outings and get-togethers.
cons: Getting promoted/raises can get pretty challenging, the company is turning more corporate, and some times it's hard to communicate with other staff members because employees are split up into different locations. I felt I didn't have much room for growth after a year.

job_title: A Director in San Jose, CA
pros: Relatively strong pay and benefits for a nonprofit; most employees strongly support the mission;  many strong leaders; strong IT resources for a nonprofit, low rate of employee turnover.
cons: Like anywhere, management skills vary across departments; it's not always easy to get the internal information you need to be successful.

review_title: rewarding, but no room for growth
pros:
- friendly, warm environment
- good benefits
- rewarding nonprofit
cons:
- no room for growth. after a year, felt like I wasn't learning anything. Not much professional development after a year
- communication between offices difficult
- difficult to get raise
- getting very corporate

pros: great benefits, dental, medical, vision, 403 (b), some friendly people to work with. 90% of the the time you work 8 hours even as a Manager.
cons: pay is on the low end of the scale, especially for the drivers. To much cross department interference.

pros: Liked delivering food to deserving people.  Good quality and nutritious food made available to the needy.  They run an organized volunteer program.
cons: Hard to work for an unresponsive transportation department manager.  Employee morale is low.  Management does not listen to new ideas.  Equipment is old and falling apart.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Jose, CA
pros: Hours are great. 8-430pm everyday. benefits are great.
cons: No room for growth. Management doesn't invest in your learning. Management is considered entry level.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in San Jose, CA
pros: SHFB is an amamzing organization which helps so many people. Rewarding work!
cons: Finances and Awarded grants do not allow for certain positions to be year round.

pros: work for the public good; committed staff; effective outreach; excellent benefits; talented managenpment
cons: pay is competitive but not generous; limited mobility; not much comraderie; heavy workload, lean staff

pros: The people are amazing and working towards decreasing the number of hungry families in Central Florida is a privilege!
cons: I am currently only working here Part time because of budget retraints
